sentences: Lapsed võtsid julgust ja tulid peidust välja külalisi uudistama.
Kõrtsides aga võetakse julgust. Kaine talupoeg on arg mehike .. E. Vilde.
Ta võttis julgust ja ütles oma arvamuse avalikult.
context: The word 'julgust' is the partitive case form of 'julgus', which means courage or confidence. It's used when taking courage to do something - essentially 'taking courage'. The first definition shows children gathering courage to come out from hiding, while the second definition refers to people in taverns taking a strong drink to build up their courage.
